intro: Tithymalus transoxanus, commonly known as the Transoxiana tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it has been cultivated in various horticultural settings.
